title: Desert people (A)
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Social conditions
description: Scenes typical of the daily life of Aborigines of the Pintubi tribe in the Western Desert cultural area, showing two families: the first was filmed as they were found living in desert conditions, the second had recently settled at Warburton Mission and demonstrated how they had lived a few months earlier. A shorter version of People of the Australian Western Desert, Pts. l, 2 and 4.
